comment: The general logarithm of a number to the base being Euler's constant is the natural logarithm of the number. Put another way, using ` _e ` as the base in ` logb ` is the same as ` log ` . Definition in [Cohen4] p. 352. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 17-Oct-2017.) (Revised by David A. Wheeler and AV, 16-Jun-2020.)
